attributes.action: Reinstate the Minor Injury/A&E Unit in Trowbridge, County Town of Wiltshire
attributes.additional_details: On the NHS Website, the opening hours are clearly stated, for the Minor Injuries Unit Trowbridge, daily from 7 a.m until 11pm. Thus leaving residents during the night potentially vulnerable, and at risk, if injured or ill. It is unrealistic to expect people to travel such a distance to Bath RUH, especially given the strain that Hospital is also under,with Staff shortages and lack of resources at crucially busy times. Surely it is more logical and viable to reinstate services within our Town.
attributes.background: Trowbridge, Population of 30 thousand plus residents,& County Town of Wiltshire, has recently had its Minor Injuries Unit closed during the night, and residents are expected to now attend the increasingly overstretched Bath RUH,.some 8 miles away, a journey of at least 35 minutes traffic depending.

rejection.details:
This decision was taken by the Wiltshire Clinical Commissioning Group, not the UK Government or Parliament. You can find out more here:

http://cms.wiltshire.gov.uk/documents/s125546/CCG%20November.pdf
